intro: Libanotis michaylovae, commonly known as the Armenian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Armenia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its blue or violet bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, showy blooms that attract pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
